description.narrative:
The Center for Sustainable development of mountainous communities (SUDECOM) was established under the decision No. 179/QĐ-LHH dated05th February 2007 by the Vietnam Union of Science and Technology Association (VUSTA). It was confered registration certificate code. A-608 by Ministry of Science and Technology (MOST). SUDECOM is non-profitable organization for the community development. It has independent legal status and a separate stamp. This organization operates on the voluntary and self-control basis and covers all expenses on its own.
SUDECOM has been carrying activities in the mountainous provinces in general and in Yen Bay province in particular. The priority is given to the areas where ethnic minority people with many difficulties lives.
Purpose of the project: People aremore capable, confident, and participate more effectively in the process of monitoring mineral mining activities of enterprises, cooperatives, and individual. People are more capable, confident, and participate more effectively in the process of monitoring miningactivities of enterprises, cooperatives, and individuals. At the same time, businesses and individual cooperatives change their perception to publicity and transparency on the contributing sources of environmental protection fees, as well local governments on therevenue and expenditure from this fund. In Article 8 Environmental protection fee for mining activities is 100% of local budget revenue to support environmental protection and investment in the locality where mining activities are located, according to the Law onEnvironmental Protection and the Law on State Budget, all of this revenue is managed and used by local authorities to remedy the environmental consequences caused by mining activities, including (i) Prevention and limit adverse impacts on the environment in the locality where mining activities are located; (ii) Overcome environmental degradation and pollution caused by mineral mining activities and (iii) Maintain hygiene, protect and regenerate the environmental landscape in the locality where mining activities are conducted. SUDECOM Center proposes a project aimed at medium-term objectives 2 and 3: * Medium-term objective: Mining units change their perception, become financially responsible andvalue chain, respect human rights in terms of labor and environment, and fulfill theirobligations and responsibilities to pay environmental protection fees from mining activities * Mid-term objective: CSOs contribute to the development and enforcement of laws, legal frameworks, and rules to ensure human rights in trade and value chain in mining activities in 2 districts and Yen Bai province, contribute to provincial and national policies.

participating-org.narrative: Center for Sustainable Development of Mountainous Communities

The Center for Sustainable Development of Mountainous Communities (SUDECOM) is one science and technology organisation under DecreeNo 81/2002/ND-CP. It has independent legal status, it own seal and bank accounts at different banks and operates under themode of autonomy and self-financing.
It main tasks include: 1. To study the application of science and technology in the area of agricultureand rural development with the purpose to support the community living in the mountainous areas that have disadvantage living conditions, need to have capacity strengthened on poverty reduction and hunger elimination. 2. To provide services on science and technology: information, consultation, new technology transfer, orgarization of scientific workshop on suchareas of agriculture and rural development. 3. To communicate and train to improve knowledge about environmental protection with sustainability; supporting communication programs and community education on hygiene, community health protection and health care; communicating to develop tradition and raising awareness of the cultural characters and values of ethnic groups. 4. To cooperate and mobilize domestic and foreign organizations, nongovernmental and governmental organizations to perform the above-mentioned tasks in the field of agriculture and rural development, which are not contrary to the Law on science and technology and the State Regulations.
